verses.text: And take thou unto thee Aaron thy brother , and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel , that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office , \add even\add* Aaron , Nadab and Abihu , Eleazar and Ithamar , Aaron’s sons.
And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother for glory and for beauty.

And thou shalt speak unto all \add that are\add* wise hearted , whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom , that they may make Aaron’s garments to consecrate him, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.

And these \add are\add* the garments which they shall make ; a breastplate , and an ephod , and a robe , and a broidered coat , a mitre , and a girdle : and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother , and his sons , that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
And they shall take gold , and blue , and purple , and scarlet , and fine linen. \p
¶ And they shall make the ephod \add of\add* gold , \add of\add* blue , and \add of\add* purple , \add of\add* scarlet , and fine twined linen , with cunning work.
It shall have the two shoulderpieces thereof joined at the two edges thereof; and \add so\add* it shall be joined together.

And the curious girdle of the ephod , which \add is\add* upon it, shall be of the same, according to the work thereof; \add even of\add* gold , \add of\add* blue , and purple , and scarlet , and fine twined linen.\f + \fr 28.8 \ft curious: or, embroidered\f*
And thou shalt take two onyx stones , and grave on them the names of the children of Israel :
Six of their names on one stone , and \add the other\add* six names of the rest on the other stone , according to their birth.

With the work of an engraver in stone , \add like\add* the engravings of a signet , shalt thou engrave the two stones with the names of the children of Israel : thou shalt make them to be set in ouches of gold.

And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod \add for\add* stones of memorial unto the children of Israel : and Aaron shall bear their names before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* upon his two shoulders for a memorial. \p
¶ And thou shalt make ouches \add of\add* gold ;
And two chains \add of\add* pure gold at the ends ; \add of\add* wreathen work shalt thou make them, and fasten the wreathen chains to the ouches. \p

¶ And thou shalt make the breastplate of judgment with cunning work ; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; \add of\add* gold , \add of\add* blue , and \add of\add* purple , and \add of\add* scarlet , and \add of\add* fine twined linen , shalt thou make it.
Foursquare it shall be \add being\add* doubled ; a span \add shall be\add* the length thereof, and a span \add shall be\add* the breadth thereof.

And thou shalt set in it settings of stones , \add even\add* four rows of stones : \add the first\add* row \add shall be\add* a sardius , a topaz , and a carbuncle : \add this shall be\add* the first row.\f + \fr 28.17 \ft set…: Heb. fill in it fillings of stone\f*\f + \fr 28.17 \ft sardius: or, ruby\f*
And the second row \add shall be\add* an emerald , a sapphire , and a diamond.
And the third row a ligure , an agate , and an amethyst.
And the fourth row a beryl , and an onyx , and a jasper : they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.\f + \fr 28.20 \ft inclosings: Heb. fillings\f*

And the stones shall be with the names of the children of Israel , twelve , according to their names , \add like\add* the engravings of a signet ; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes. \p
¶ And thou shalt make upon the breastplate chains at the ends \add of\add* wreathen work \add of\add* pure gold.
And thou shalt make upon the breastplate two rings of gold , and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
And thou shalt put the two wreathen \add chains\add* of gold in the two rings \add which are\add* on the ends of the breastplate.
And \add the other\add* two ends of the two wreathen \add chains\add* thou shalt fasten in the two ouches , and put \add them\add* on the shoulderpieces of the ephod before it. \p
¶ And thou shalt make two rings of gold , and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the breastplate in the border thereof, which \add is\add* in the side of the ephod inward.

And two \add other\add* rings of gold thou shalt make , and shalt put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath , toward the forepart thereof, over against the \add other\add* coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.

And they shall bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue , that \add it\add* may be above the curious girdle of the ephod , and that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod.

And Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart , when he goeth in unto the holy \add place\add*, for a memorial before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* continually. \p

¶ And thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim ; and they shall be upon Aaron’s heart , when he goeth in before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* continually. \p
¶ And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all \add of\add* blue.
And there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of an habergeon , that it be not rent. \p

¶ And \add beneath\add* upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegranates \add of\add* blue , and \add of\add* purple , and \add of\add* scarlet , round about the hem thereof; and bells of gold between them round about :\f + \fr 28.33 \ft hem: or, skirts\f*
A golden bell and a pomegranate , a golden bell and a pomegranate , upon the hem of the robe round about.

And it shall be upon Aaron to minister : and his sound shall be heard when he goeth in unto the holy \add place\add* before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and when he cometh out, that he die not. \p
¶ And thou shalt make a plate \add of\add* pure gold , and grave upon it, \add like\add* the engravings of a signet , HOLINESS TO THE \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And thou shalt put it on a blue lace , that it may be upon the mitre ; upon the forefront of the mitre it shall be.

And it shall be upon Aaron’s forehead , that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things , which the children of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts ; and it shall be always upon his forehead , that they may be accepted before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ And thou shalt embroider the coat of fine linen , and thou shalt make the mitre \add of\add* fine linen , and thou shalt make the girdle \add of\add* needlework. \p
¶ And for Aaron’s sons thou shalt make coats , and thou shalt make for them girdles , and bonnets shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.

And thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother , and his sons with him; and shalt anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office.\f + \fr 28.41 \ft consecrate…: Heb. fill their hand\f*

And thou shalt make them linen breeches to cover their nakedness ; from the loins even unto the thighs they shall reach:\f + \fr 28.42 \ft their…: Heb. flesh of their nakedness\f*\f + \fr 28.42 \ft reach: Heb. be\f*

And they shall be upon Aaron , and upon his sons , when they come in unto the tabernacle of the congregation , or when they come near unto the altar to minister in the holy \add place;\add* that they bear not iniquity , and die : \add it shall be\add* a statute for ever unto him and his seed after him.
